text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
frozen cake pop tutorial I'm going to be
showing you how to make all of your
favorite frozen characters into
delicious cake pops this has been so
incredibly heavily requested so if you
guys think I've done a good job on it
I'd love it if you'd give it a like give
it a share let me know your thoughts in
the comments below
tools an equipment that you'll need
today I've got a ziploc bag and I've
also got just some regular sticky tape
I've got six cake pop balls ready to go
and I've also got my frozen templates so
I'm going to leave a link to both these
templates and our cake pop ball recipe
in the description box below I've got
some paintbrushes and I'm using really
nice soft kind of fluffy paintbrushes
today for a bit of dry work some
lollipop sticks just a piece of
chocolate or a chocolate melt some mini
M&Ms in brown I've got some melted dark
chocolate some melted white chocolate a
pair of scissors and a butter knife and
I've got my luster dust
so luster dust is basically like a
shimmery powder that you buy from cake
decorating shops and I've got mine in
light blue pink purple which I didn't
use dark blue and just a white shimmer
I've also got just a flat tray and a
couple of bits of wax paper to rest our
pops on today so let's get started you
firstly want to shape your cake
footballs to these not being
refrigerated they're not firmed up just
yet you want to take your first pop ball
and you just want to rock it between the
palm of your hands with your hands on a
bit of an angle to make sort of this
triangular shape and then take it and
just smack it on the bench a couple of
times to give it a really nice flat
bottom you just want to sort of shape it
so that what you've got is a long
triangle shape that's going to make one
of our princess skirts and then you want
to repeat this process exactly the same
for your second one because we've got
two princesses today and we want both of
those ghosts to be roughly the same once
you've done those we're going to shape
honza's legs to be perfectly honest I
wasn't incredibly happy with how Hans
turned out but I felt like his legs
should have been taller and a little bit
sharper on the edges for your fourth
cake pop just take it that nice ball and
just kind of squish it don't go too thin
here and then I just sort of made one a
little bit more of an overly shape than
a round shape for your fifth ball you
want to tear off 1/4 of that ball and
then you want to roll the larger portion
to a nice round ball and then
do the same with your smaller portion
this is going to be Olaf and his body's
in two parts so we can't afford that
bigger and smaller ball and you'll find
a one is just going to stay exactly as
it is it doesn't even have to be
particularly neat pop these ones all up
into the fridge for at least 15 to 20
minutes until they're really nice and
firmly set coming back from the fridge
all of your cake pops should be set
really nice and hard so you shouldn't be
able to push them out of shape and you
want to take your first round ball it's
going to have a slightly flat bottom on
it that's perfect leave the flat bottom
on the base dip your lollipop stick into
a bit of that dark chocolate pop your
ball on the wax paper and just stick
that lollipop stick straight in letting
that cake pop rest on the flat bottom
moving on to Olaf you want to take the
lollipop stick and you just want to
stick it straight through the center no
chocolate or anything on the stick with
about half an inch three quarters of an
inch sticking out the bottom dip that
into your white chocolate and use the
white chocolate to essentially join your
larger circle in your smaller circle
together for your other ones the three
taller ones these are a little bit more
of an awkward shape so you want your
lollipop stick to be coming about
halfway down this shape so just
basically dipping that lollipop stick
straight into the white chocolate and as
I insert it particularly into the pointy
into the girls skirts I'm twisting that
cake pop stick because it's helping to
insert it a little bit easier and it
goes in without cracking the cake pop
ball do that with all three of your
taller so your parents and your two
skirts and then feel a little flat piece
this is going to be a bit of an iceberg
but it's a really problematic shape to
actually dip so I just took my knife or
a spoon and just scoop some white
chocolate out over the top of it making
sure that you cover it completely and
then you want to take a bit more of that
melted white chocolate and we're just
going to scoop that out straight down
onto the wax paper to give it a sort of
a bit of a base or a bit of a foot be
quite generous with this coat that's
straight on the wax paper because you do
need a good support for this cake pop
and then just use your knife to lift the
cake pop up and set it on top so it's
got a nice foot once again doesn't have
to be perfect dip a lollipop stick into
the white chocolate and insert it
straight into the centre of your little
iceberg cake pop all of those are going
back off into the fridge only for about
five minutes or so to let their
chocolate completely set once all of
your pops is set it's time to dip the
rest of them so as I mentioned one of
them is going to pick chocolate brown
all right dip I always like to take a
lollipop stick or a spoon or something
and just stir up my chocolate right
before I pop those pops in it just helps
to keep it really nice and fluid and
gives you a really nice neat dip dip
your cake pop in so that it comes all
the way over the chocolate seal and your
chocolates meeting up with that lollipop
stick and just shake off any excess and
then press it down into that wax paper
and that chocolate will form a nice base
the rest of your cake pops are all going
to be dipped in white so you can move
your brown to the side and you just want
to take them and just dip them straight
in once again making sure your white
chocolate comes over that nice set firm
seal tapping off a little bit of the
excess but don't tap off too much
because you want it to form a nice
little foot as you can see there when I
put them down on the wax paper the
chocolate kind of slides out a little
bit and gives them a really nice flat
base so they're not going to wobble
around they're going to be quite stable
do that with your two skirts and also
hands as parents and then feel final one
all up if you want to take your dark
chocolate or your dark candy melt and
you just want to cut essentially to
little stick sized pieces for his arm so
your break couple here but just cut a
couple of Joe you've got two little
pieces that you're happy with
take Olaf dip him into your melted white
chocolate make sure that you put your
sticks and your little brown M&Ms at the

and the other two M&Ms sort of coming
down like buttons on his little bottom

stick them straight in kind of up in the
air like they're waving around a little
bit more of that white chocolate goes
into your ziploc bag
push it all the way to the end let any
area and just snip off a bit of a rough

size and then we're just using it just
to drizzle some of that white chocolate
onto our little Boulder this is supposed
to look like freshly fallen snow that's
just come onto the boulder give it a
little couple of taps just to drizzle
that snow down and then pop it back on
the wax paper perfect now if you're
going to be cracks in your cake pop ball
and it is more likely to happen on your
taller ones take that ziplock bag again
and just squeeze a little bit of that
melted white chocolate into the crack
making sure that you come about a
centimetre or so past where the crack
starts and finishes counter about five
to let that chocolate start to set and
then just use your finger and just wipe
it off it's going to
press the chocolate into the crack and
it's going to seal out that cracks your
cake pops salvageable taking honza's
pants now you just want to use the back
of your knife and just kind of gently
slide up and down to make a bit of a
definite gap between his pants legs but
don't go too hard you'll crack the cake
pop ball take your luster dust now and
start with your lighter blue so that if
you mess up your surface in your brushes
you can just move on to your dark colors
anyway and we're just going to brush
this down straight on to that step white
chocolate normally with the last two
dust I like to use a little bit of

that these are going to go mostly to
kids and a lot of people don't like kids

this is actually going to be for her
pink or purple cape
I had pink and purple bows at the ready

either side of your cake pops tip spin
